description.narrative: This project has been proposed with the underpinning that elections is a critical event for democracy and good governance for countries in the region when communities exercise their right to commit elect new leaders at local (ward), sub regional (county) and national parliament (senators, women representatives and members of parliament) and presidential). In the light of and being called to be agents of change, the election observation mission and activities are envisaged to promote local, agency, voice and leadership. AMECEA has planned to train and send short term and long-term observers in events leading towards August 2022 elections. In March/April the AMECEA Election Observer Mission will deploy 10 long-term observers (LTOs) to counties of Kenya in teams of two, they will be observing in approximately 10 of Kenya constituencies. Shortly before Election Day, the mission will be reinforced by 20 short-term observers (STOs), who join to observe Election Day activities at the polling stations. LTOs and STOs will also be joined by the diplomats from AMECEA regional Member Conferences and residents in Kenya. This brings the total number of AMECEA Election observers over the Election Day period to approximately about 40 over a period of about 5-6 months. This project will contribute £19,999 to this mission AMECEA will reach out to other CI agencies for additional resources.
